skillTree.localised_description: This mighty Bale Taurus carries the dread Sorcerer Drazhoath the Ashen, Lord of the Black Fortress, to battle, at the head of his twisted Legion of Azgorh, to bring fire and Ruin down upon the foe.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
Witnessing other friendly units rout will only affect this unit's leadership if they also have the Contempt attribute.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee (300s)

skillTree.localised_description: With a leader this cruel, is it any surprise that his troops are obedient and loyal to the end? Fear is the most effective motivator.
The Father of Darkness protects his children from sorcery through a variety of magical means, all of them twisted and obscure.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors
Hero self-defence: +10% chance of wounding aggressors

skillTree.localised_description: Having a thing for hats can be most useful when everyone keeps aiming at your head…
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +10% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +10%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +20% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +30%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Walls? I see only piles of sand crafted by children. Bring my brothers close enough and we shall take pleasure in fulfilling our bargain and topple them for you!"

effects.description:
Construction time: -1 for all buildings (minimum of 1 turn)
	(local province)

Construction cost: -10% for all buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Almost killing as one, horrendous violence clearly runs in their blood.

effects.description: Armament cost: -10% for increasing capacity of Infernal Guard and Infernal Ironsworn units

Upkeep: -5% for Infernal Guard and Infernal Ironsworn units
	(Lord's army)

Bonus vs infantry: +5 for Infernal Guard and Infernal Ironsworn units
	(Lord's army)
Armament cost: -20% for increasing capacity of Infernal Guard and Infernal Ironsworn units

Upkeep: -10% for Infernal Guard and Infernal Ironsworn units
	(Lord's army)

Bonus vs infantry: +10 for Infernal Guard and Infernal Ironsworn units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Truly their greed knows no bounds, as they strip the dead of every last scrap of dignity.
A minor Daemonsmith no longer, Drazhoath has raised himself to greatness in his chosen field: to create the K'daai, half-raging fire, half-Daemon essence – all mindless destructive force.

effects.description: Armament cost: -10% for increasing capacity of K'daai units

Weapon strength: +10% for K'daai units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for all K'daai units
	(Lord's army)
Armament cost: -20% for increasing capacity of K'daai units

ui_effects.localised_text: Restores the hitpoints of units with the Hell-Forged attribute

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% for K'daai units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for all K'daai units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The cinders and clinker from the grate beneath his sacrificial altar both heal Drazhoath and ward against magic.
High up in the turrets of the Black Fortress, Drazhoath has waited, developing his sorcerous skills and biding his time.

effects.description:
Weakness to Fire Damage: -10%
	(enemy armies in region)
Winds of Magic cost: -5 for "Flames of Azgorh"
Winds of Magic cost: -5 for "Flames of Azgorh Upgraded"

	(enemy armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: "The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me."
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

attributes.bullet_text: When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Though they face almost-certain death at the enemy's hands, that has to be better than what the Chaos Dwarfs have in store for their Greenskin underlings, right? Some even welcome such an end.

effects.description:
Leadership: +2 for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders Melee units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +4 for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders Melee units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +3 for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders Melee units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders Melee units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders Melee units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Wearing ultra-resilient armour forged with blood and hellfire, the Chaos Dwarfs present a  mighty defensive wall, stronger even than steel, to their incautious, overconfident enemies.

effects.description:
Armour: +4 for Chaos Dwarf Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +8 for Chaos Dwarf Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +3 for Chaos Dwarf Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +12 for Chaos Dwarf Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Chaos Dwarf Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Drilling loading, shooting and reloading, until they become second nature, so the foe is under constant barrage, is surely the way to victory.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +4% for Hobgoblin Archers, Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses, Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders (Bows) units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for Hobgoblin Archers, Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses, Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders (Bows) units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Hobgoblin Archers, Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses, Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders (Bows) units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for Hobgoblin Archers, Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses, Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders (Bows) units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Hobgoblin Archers, Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses, Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders (Bows) units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Beneath their mutated faces and ever-darkened souls, the Chaos Dwarfs are still Dwarfs at heart, retaining all of their counterparts' metalworking skill and knack for ingenious engineering solutions.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +6% for Iron Daemon and Artillery units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +12% for Iron Daemon and Artillery units
	(Lord's army)

Range: +5% for Iron Daemon and Artillery units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for Iron Daemon and Artillery units
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Iron Daemon and Artillery units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Assuming you can't avoid the confrontation altogether, the most sensible course of action is to get well out of the way!

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +4% for Bull Centaur Renders units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +8% for Bull Centaur Renders units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +4 for Bull Centaur Renders units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Bull Centaur Renders units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +9 for Bull Centaur Renders units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Daemonic fire-elementals and various other monstrous creatures in the Chaos Dwarfs' service are fielded to crack the skulls and crush the souls of those who dare stand against them.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +4% for Great Taurus, Lammasu, Bale Taurus, K'daai and Skullcracker units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +3 for Great Taurus, Lammasu, Bale Taurus, K'daai and Skullcracker units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +8% for Great Taurus, Lammasu, Bale Taurus, K'daai and Skullcracker units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Great Taurus, Lammasu, Bale Taurus, K'daai and Skullcracker units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even though they're considered little more than a raw resource by their evil masters, some Greenskins avoid being worked to death by "assisting" their keepers on the field of battle.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 10% for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To be this effective in battle takes not just suicidal levels of courage and determination, but the discipline to hold the line and, as one, take the fight directly into the enemy's wavering hearts.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Chaos Dwarf Melee Infantry units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Chaos Dwarf Melee Infantry units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for Chaos Dwarf Melee Infantry units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: From the barrels of the Chaos Dwarfs' infernal war machines are fired shrieking rockets and blasts of raw, Ruinous magick, leaving those not instantly turned to liquid quaking and gibbering in their wake.

effects.description:
Explosive missile damage: +12% for Iron Daemon and Artillery units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Iron Daemon, Artillery, Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses and Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for Iron Daemon and Artillery, Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses and Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Iron Daemon and Artillery, Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses and Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those twisted, hellishly-mutated monsters in the service of the Chaos Dwarfs are some of their most effective weapons, particularly when organised into a malign host of Ruinous shock troops.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +12% for Bull Centaur Renders, Great Taurus, Lammasu, Bale Taurus, K'daai and Skullcracker units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Bull Centaur Renders, Great Taurus, Lammasu, Bale Taurus, K'daai and Skullcracker units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Bull Centaur Renders, Great Taurus, Lammasu, Bale Taurus, K'daai and Skullcracker units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +20%

skillTree.localised_description: Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Beatings WILL continue until morale improves, or even if it does...
Some conquerors are mild and fair. Not so this one, whose savagery and corruption truly know no bounds.
A Dawi-Zharr such as he does not care for being wounded – by his will alone he continues to fight.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.
To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them – this is what Chaos wants.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die. There is no other option."

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -5% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -10% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -15% for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Brutality or viciousness don't go anywhere near far enough. Even barbarism is too mild a term.

attributes.bullet_text: Witnessing other friendly units rout will only affect this unit's leadership if they also have the Contempt attribute.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

factionEffects.localised_description: Exiled from Zharr-Naggrund by Lord Astragoth, after his political intrigues failed, to the forbidding Black Fortress, Drazhoath has been plotting his return – and his revenge – for many long centuries.

effects.description:
Siege towers: +2 per siege item constructed
	(own armies factionwide)
Research rate: +5% for every tower settlement
Armaments cost: -10% for all unit capacity upgrades in the Hell-Forge

Fire resistance: 20%
	(own armies factionwide in owned territory)

items.colour_text: A badge of rank and high office, this iron staff-mace, which carries the runic names of every past master of the Black Fortress, is bound with baleful prayers to Hashut.

item_set.name: Master of the Black Fortress
item_set.description: The twisted, power-hungry commander of the Legion of Azgorh, Drazhoath is the undisputed master of all he surveys.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for embedded Infernal Castellan Heroes
	(all armies factionwide)

items.colour_text: The icy hate of Drazhoath's malice is amplified a thousandfold within its black crystal depths, and unleashed on any who would dare spill his blood.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10
	(Lord's army)

item_set.name: Master of the Black Fortress
item_set.description: The twisted, power-hungry commander of the Legion of Azgorh, Drazhoath is the undisputed master of all he surveys.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for embedded Infernal Castellan Heroes
	(all armies factionwide)

items.colour_text: Forged from meteoric iron and blighted gold, quenched in innocent blood and bound with slain, hell-bound souls, the Crucible is said to have been the handiwork of the ancient Chaos Dwarf Sorcerer Azgorh himself.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each kill made by the unit (100)

effects.description: Targeting range: +25% for Lore of Hashut spells

item_set.name: Master of the Black Fortress
item_set.description: The twisted, power-hungry commander of the Legion of Azgorh, Drazhoath is the undisputed master of all he surveys.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for embedded Infernal Castellan Heroes
	(all armies factionwide)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Hidden skill to grant Drazhoath characters extra scaling
In a society where the most heinous acts of cruelty are applauded – nay, *rewarded* – his atrocious tyranny is actually considered to be a positive thing.

effects.description:
Enemy fire resistance: -20%
	(enemy armies in region)

Requires line of sight to the target
